decision: Implement Phase 2 vector embeddings using Ollama nomic-embed-text model
rationale: Semantic search enables finding conceptually related content without keyword matches. Ollama runs locally without API costs or network requirements. nomic-embed-text produces 768-dimensional embeddings with good quality for this use case.
title: Implement Phase 2 vector embeddings using Ollama nomic-embed-text model

decision: Implement Phase 3 graph-enhanced recall with BFS traversal and edge-weighted scoring
rationale: Graph expansion surfaces related knowledge that keyword and semantic search miss. Starting from search results or graph node matches, BFS traversal follows edges up to configurable depth. Score decay (0.7^hop) and edge type weights ensure direct matches rank higher than distant relationships.
title: Implement Phase 3 graph-enhanced recall with BFS traversal and edge-weighted scoring

decision: Entire checkpoint 699508ff13: 1 session(s) on main, files: LINEAGE_CONTRACT.md, LORE_CONTRACT.md, lineage.sh, mani.yaml
rationale: Tokens: 1940 in / 12032 out
title: Entire checkpoint 699508ff13: 1 session(s) on main, files: LINEAGE_CONTRACT.md, LORE_CONTRACT.md, lineage.sh, mani.yaml

decision: Adopt Sovereign Bridge architecture for Claude Code integration
rationale: Lore owns the *what* and *why* (intent, decisions, patterns, failures). Claude Code owns the *how* and *when* (task execution). Spec files serve as contracts between layers — they define goals, success criteria, context, and done conditions without prescribing implementation. This separation prevents coupling between memory/context and execution, allows different agents to interpret specs independently, and keeps Lore as the single source of truth for strategic direction.
alternatives: Direct tasks.json export (rejected: couples Lore to Claude Code's internal format)
Real-time MCP delegation (rejected: creates runtime dependency)
title: Adopt Sovereign Bridge architecture for Claude Code integration

decision: Fork-on-resume: resume creates new session inheriting context from parent
rationale: Historical sessions become immutable after handoff. New work writes to forked session with parent_session link, preventing pollution of example/historical data.
title: Fork-on-resume: resume creates new session inheriting context from parent

decision: Fleet management strategy: start with visibility (Praxis), graduate to automated provisioning (Morpheus Lite) only when data proves the need
rationale: Multi-agent coordination uses ~15x more tokens than single-agent work. Building fleet automation before proving ROI of parallel agents is premature. Phase 1 visibility gathers data to justify Phase 2+ investment.
title: Fleet management strategy: start with visibility (Praxis), graduate to automated provisioning (Morpheus Lite) only when data proves the need

decision: Geordi buildout: Foundation phase first (split monolith, add caching, tests) before adding new features
rationale: 1,757-line server.py resists extension. Module split enables parallel development and safe refactoring. Critic's position: don't add features to a monolith.
alternatives: Add features to monolith first (technical debt)
title: Geordi buildout: Foundation phase first (split monolith, add caching, tests) before adding new features

decision: Implement entire-resume wrapper for Lore context injection
rationale: Closes the checkpoints → journal → patterns → resume loop. Wrapper script queries patterns and decisions before running 'entire resume'
title: Implement entire-resume wrapper for Lore context injection

decision: Tasks use YAML files under intent/data/tasks/ rather than append-only JSONL
rationale: Tasks need rich structure (title, description, context), individual file access for claim/complete operations, and human-readable format for inspection. JSONL works for inbox (high-volume, append-only) but YAML matches goals/missions pattern.
title: Tasks use YAML files under intent/data/tasks/ rather than append-only JSONL

decision: Documentation/Onboarding initiative: standardize doc structure across projects, create cross-project onboarding guide, measure retrieval
rationale: Survey found inconsistent entry points (Geordi lacks README), no CONTRIBUTING.md anywhere, no cross-project guide. New agents face 2+ hour ramp-up that could be 30 minutes.
title: Documentation/Onboarding initiative: standardize doc structure across projects, create cross-project onboarding guide, measure retrieval

decision: Agent Definitions initiative: formalize agent roles with explicit capabilities, constraints, and readiness criteria in Lore registry schema
rationale: Survey found capabilities are implicit (omitting tools field grants everything), no constraints exist (budgets, timeouts), roles are tribal knowledge. Allowlist-based tool access closes security gap.
title: Agent Definitions initiative: formalize agent roles with explicit capabilities, constraints, and readiness criteria in Lore registry schema

decision: Decompose agent teams by deliverable type, not by target project
rationale: Each agent owns a distinct set of files, eliminating cross-agent conflicts. One-agent-per-project requires sequencing when the same design pattern must apply across all projects simultaneously.
alternatives: One agent per project -- rejected because all 6 CLAUDE.md files needed the same ecosystem snippet pattern applied
forcing sequential execution or conflict resolution
title: Decompose agent teams by deliverable type, not by target project

decision: Demote initiative phases that depend on unbuilt infrastructure to Future with a checkpoint gate
rationale: Keeping a phase as committed work when its dependency does not exist creates false confidence. A checkpoint gate forces validation that earlier phases delivered value before investing in later ones.
alternatives: Keep Phase 3 as a committed phase -- rejected because Lore telemetry infrastructure does not exist; the phase could not execute. Remove Phase 3 entirely -- rejected because the measurement goal is still valid.
title: Demote initiative phases that depend on unbuilt infrastructure to Future with a checkpoint gate

decision: Team leads read Lore before spawning agents and invoke lore-scribe once after completion
rationale: Reads are cheap and fail-silent via lore-client-base.sh; writes need curation -- parallel agent writes produce duplicates, null fields, and journal noise. The team lead acts as a single curation gate, observed after doc-onboarding session produced duplicate entries and null title fields.
alternatives: Auto-read/write from every agent (race conditions on JSONL append
journal dilution); no Lore integration for teams (agents rediscover captured patterns); PostToolUse hook on TeamCreate (hook event does not exist

decision: Archive Flow and Bach from cli — orchestration concepts move to Neo, Go CLI is scaffolding only
rationale: Flow tracks state and dispatches; Bach provides prompt templates. Neither executes tasks — real execution happens via Claude Code subagents spawned by the Task tool. The 'task execution' framing was wrong. Flow's orchestration concepts (state, contracts, execute/plan/review cycle) are absorbed into Neo at the ecosystem level. Bach's worker templates lack active dispatchers. Key artifacts (TASK_CONTRACT envelope, incapability signaling) are already in Lore or inherited by Neo.
alternatives: Keep Flow as the orchestration layer in cli; extract only Bach; promote Flow+Bach to ecosystem-level repos
